intro: Boscia uhligii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and smooth, greyish bark. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that resemble snowballs, followed by orange or red fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Boscia uhligii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
